course.subject: ACCT
course.name: Financial Accounting II
course.description: Continuation of ACCT 3010. Special problems in accounting for owner's equity and long-term liabilities including corporate bonds, leases, deferred taxation and pensions.

reviews.author: Mandy LHY200
reviews.comment_content:
1. Current liabilities, provisions and contingencies
2. Non-current liabilities
3. Equity
4. Investments
5. Dilutive securities and earnings per share
6. Accounting for income taxes
7. Accounting for pensions and post-retirement benefits
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Yue is friendly and helpful. She encourages ppls to ask questions and is willing to answer students' enquiries. The teaching pace in class is alright and her teaching style is good. She would provide some in-class practice (mainly MCQs) so as to help us understand the concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
20% - 4 Online Homework Assignment (MCQs): 252/256
40% - Midterm Exam (22 MCQs + 3 Fill-in-the-blanks): 96/96
40% - Final Exam (20 MCQs + 5 Fill-in-the-blanks): 76/88

Final Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: There are 4 online assignments (mainly MCQs), 1 midterm and 1 final exam.

reviews.author: 懷疑人生
reviews.comment_content:
[Zoom Class]
1. Current liabilities, provisions and contingencies
2. Non-current liabilities
3. Equity
4. Investments
5. Dilutive securities and earnings per share
6. Accounting for income taxes
7. Accounting for pensions and post-retirement benefits
reviews.comment_teaching: I enjoyed Yue's lecture. She goes through each point clearly with in-class questions (Zoom polling questions) for us to practice. She will also do a quick recap on previous lecture materials each lecture to strengthen our memories a bit.
reviews.comment_grading:
20% - 4 Online Homework Assignment (MCQs): 256/256
40% - Midterm Exam (22 MCQs + 3 Fill-in-the-blanks): 96/96
40% - Final Exam (20 MCQs + 5 Fill-in-the-blanks): 72/88
Final Grade: A
-
Both Midterm and Final Exam are open book. The questions are similar to those in the assignment and in-class polling questions. Final Exam is non-cumulative.
reviews.comment_workload: 4 assignment with about 30 MCQs each, 2 attempts are allowed for each assignment. They are good practices for Midterm and Final Exam!

reviews.author: 也許不必知道我是誰
reviews.comment_content:
Midterm
Ch.13 Current Liabilities, Provisions & Contingencies
Ch.14 Non-Current Liabilities
Ch.15 Equity
Ch.16 Dilutive Securities & Earnings per Share

Final
Ch.17 Financial Assets
Ch.19 Accounting for Income Taxes
Ch.20 Accounting for Pensions & Post-retirement Benefits
Ch.21 Accounting for Leases

睇落好多嘢要學咁，其實差唔多一半嘅topic都係計下annuity啲PV FV咁。Take呢個course之前記住溫返熟之前學過FINA2303嘅嘢，唔係就知味道 :)
reviews.comment_teaching: 基本上上過3010 Amy姐堂，做個比較就知Dennis教得有幾好。上堂無廢話，簡單直接，講解完每個要學嘅concept之後會教埋你點記住唔同嘅accounting treatment，有少少似教考試技巧，話曬每個topic都咁多個journal entries 名要記。問問題都好有耐性答。
reviews.comment_grading:
Classwork 6%
Assignment 9%
Term Test (即係midterm) 30%
Final Exam 55%

Classwork基本上就係lecture notes嘅例子改下數字，叫你抄多次journal entries，計少少數就交得。Classwork都係random attendance check，有交就有分。

Assignment成個sem其實得一份，重要剩係關Ch.13事，不過極伏，你會望住條題目跟住喺度懷疑人生：吓乜上堂有講過呢個情況點處理咩？3個section都無人滿分就知份功課有幾伏。
Mean: 39.8/55   SD: 6.6   Max: 54
Me: 41.5/55 (踩median咋)

MT有30條MC，2題短問答，類似classwork咁做少少journal entries，難就反而難在MC。時間極緊逼，無咩人做得曬，做完又係會懷疑人生嗰隻。你亦都唔難估到，mean喺SBM course嚟講係低得出奇。
Mean: 43.5/75   SD: 11.2   Max: 67
Me: 62/75

Final只考後4課，每課1條長問題，加埋4題。時間相對充裕，但係題目嘅問法同Wiley Engage嘅題目完全唔同，做卷嘅時候你嘅反應會係：係咪咁做架？好似唔係好肯定喎。重要每一題都會咁覺得。
Final無出分直接出grade，竟然A+，讀咗科大3年第一支A+，真係多謝Dennis。
reviews.comment_workload: 溫書，操下書啲數同做assignment之外就無，同埋Dennis剩係會update佢嘅suggested exercise嘅答案，而唔係成份WE答案擺上canvas。不過個人絕對相信起碼一部份嘅題目係Dennis自己出，特別係Assignment同Final Exam，唔好以為死記lecture notes同solution就有用，理解好重要。

reviews.author: Testing1234
reviews.title: Hard work does pay off
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 13. Current liabilities, provisions and contingencies
Chapter 14. Non-current liabilities
Chapter 15. Equity
Chapter 16. Dilutive securities and earnings per share

Midterm Exam (Ch 13, 14, 15, 16)

Chapter 17. Investments
Chapter 19. Accounting for income taxes
Chapter 20. Accounting for pensions and postretirement benefits
Chapter 21. Accounting for leases

Final Exam (Ch 17, 19, 20, 21)
reviews.comment_teaching: Daniel is a good professor. This is his first time teaching at HKUST. He tried his best to be friends with us. Since it is his first time teaching, he may overestimated our ability and teach a little bit too fast. After students' feedback, he adjusted his teaching speed and I think it is much better. Although he teaches quite fast, it is not his fault cause the schedule of this course itself is very tough. In general, Daniel is a good teacher who teaches clearly and is willing to help. Just register in his section if you see his name.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5%
4 homework assignments 15%
Midterm exam 40%
Final exam (non-cumulative) 40%

Me:
Participation: full (most people get full marks)
Assignments: full (most people get full marks)
Midterm: 80.5/100 (mean 65.2, sd 18, LQ 51.1, UQ 79, Min 24, Max 97)
Final: 100/100  (mean 79.5, sd 13.8, LQ 70.75, UQ 91, Min 36, Max 100)

Grade: A

I think it's reasonable. Daniel thinks the result of midterm exam is worse than his expectation, so he adjusted the difficulty of the final exam. You can also prepare one A4 cheatsheet (2-sided) for both the midterm and final exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
Reasonable.
You'll have to complete 4 assignments, which arent very hard and you have 1-2 attempts for each question. There are around 10-12 questions per assignment.  Though I spent some time to check if my answers are 100% correct before submitting them.
The preparation of cheatsheet is easy, you can finish a very detailed cheatsheet in a day.

reviews.author: Hayoha
reviews.title: Just personal opinion
reviews.comment_content:
Required textbook: Kieso, Weygandt, Warfield. Intermediate Accounting: IFRS
Edition, 4th edition (2020), John Wiley & Sons.
Ch. 13-16, 17, 19-21
reviews.comment_teaching: I think he is doing a great job considering this is his first semester of teaching. The Korean accent would not affect your understanding. He tried to make the lecture not that boring, I heard he would play K-POP music for L2/L3. However, I do not like him often being late for class (I am L1, the first session of the day), roughly around 5-10 minutes. He has the recordings for all lectures but only give to the students who have sick leave (doctor's letter).
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 5%
4 Assignment 15%
Midterm 40%
Final (non-cumulative) 40%

5% of the total grade is allocated to class participation. Every student will be assigned a
baseline score of 4%. Proactive participation both in and out of the classroom will lead to a full
5% score. Distracting behaviours that limit the ability of other students to focus on course
material will lead to a reduced score of 3%.
However, there is no attendance sheet to sign on, you never know how to be 'Proactive participation', maybe you need to be the students who he could recognize. If you want to get full score, can sit at the front and try to respond to him every time.

This sem, his midterm was difficult and the mean was low, but then he adjusted so the final was easier.
reviews.comment_workload:
I think the workload is ok, just 4 assignments, and you can find the similar questions in the textbook first, then you do the textbook questions and check the answer. But mostly the similar questions are Problem questions which Daniel would not provide the answer untill the Chapter was finished. You may search online and double check your procedures are correct before trying the HW questions. try to get full score for them as the exam could be difficult.
Although the number of chapters seems less than that in ACCT3010, they are more difficult. I recommend you to finish all Wiley Plus Practice Questions and Professor's recommended questions before midterm and final. Good Luck!

reviews.author: AlphaGo
reviews.title: hard work will pay off
reviews.comment_content:
so much content and quick fast paced, no attendance no recording.
talk about the lease, pension, debt, and equity investment
reviews.comment_teaching: passionate and easy to follow. It seems like it is the first (or second) time he teaches this course, quite young.
reviews.comment_grading: not yet released, mt mean is 6x/10. mines is 8x. He lowered the difficulty in final which ensure everyone has sufficient time to finish (at least half hour for me)
reviews.comment_workload: 4 assignment total, each covering 2 chapters, mostly 1 or 2 attempt is allowed, but should be easy to capture full mark or 9x if have friends to do it together

reviews.author: swaggerjaggerry
reviews.title: Tough course - needs a LOOTTT of practice
reviews.comment_content:
Midterm
- Current Liabilities, Provisions, and Contingencies
- Non-Current Liabilities
- Equity
- Dilutive Securities and Earnings per Share

Finals
- Financial Assets
- Accounting for Income Taxes
- Accounting for Pensions and Post- retirement Benefits
- Accounting for Leases
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof was just rereading and explaining the slides, I don't think there was any value add coming to class except for when he gives out random in-class exercises which counts towards your grade (the only incentive to attend)...

Reading the ppt is sufficient (or read the textbook if you need extra explanations, which is available for free as a pdf).

Towards the midterm & final exams, students will usually ask questions via Canvas discussion board about the end-of-chapter exercise questions, which was really helpful in clarifying some parts, or to point out mistakes in the answer key.

Also, don't buy the $200 something course package because it's OPTIONAL and not worth the money at all
reviews.comment_grading:
Class works (short questions) 6%
Assignment (questions set) 9%
Midterm Test (multiple choice and short-answers questions) 30%
Final Examination (long scenario-type questions) 55%
reviews.comment_workload:
For me, it was challenging because there was SO many different accounts for journal entries and you have to get the hang of it (or memorise) as there was no cheat sheet. There was also too many diff accounting treatments for each case... so please do the end-of-chapter exercise questions several times until you feel comfortable doing it without looking at your notes and getting them correctly, otherwise you will REALLY struggle in the exam.

Besides personal practice, workload was just the in-class exercises (I think there was 6 in total, all easy and graded on submission), and 1 homework set (difficult).

Overall, really understand the material because the midterm and finals will be VERY demanding because it's not a similar replica of the end-of-chapter exercise questions (with unexpected extra variations), so please don't underestimate his exams. Really budget your time wisely (esp for midterm) because each question can take an unexpectedly longer time.

reviews.author: 森姆
reviews.comment_content:
If covers more advanced topic in financial accounting, including time value of money, liabilities provision and contingencies, non-current liabilities. Some topics are also related to finance like equity, dilutive securities and earning per share. There are also some topics which are related to the higher level course for accounting student like income taxes, pensions and post-retirement benefits, leases.

These concepts are not difficult themselves, but just have to remember many different treatment and sceanario. When working on the textbook questions, there may have different cases and student have to make careful judgment on deciding what kind of treatment used in that specific scenario.

The content covered in this course is very practical and useful for financial accounting. It wrapped up the topics learnt in previous course and laid a good foundation for the learning in more advanced accounting course later.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lecturer teaching is great. She explained the concepts clear and well. It was a bit of pity that the lecture time is really not enough for lecturer to demonstrate more complicated cases from the textbook and students have to spend their own time to work on the questions to get familiar with the concepts.
The lecturer is patient in answering students' questions and I can see her passion in teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz(3*20%)
Final exam(40%)

***Student can choose to not going for quizzes and the percentage would be added to the final exam
(e.g. if you skip all 3 quizzes, the final exam will be 100% of the course grade)

Getting pass is not difficult at all (I got D in this course with the overall score 2x/100)
reviews.comment_workload:
There are nearly no workload in this course as there are no project and no assignments. However, same as the most accounting courses, if you want to get good grade, you have to do more practice from the textbook and get familiar with the question types and concepts learnt in the lecture.

If

reviews.author: Tommy Sze
reviews.comment_content: Topics include non-current liability, bond, taxation, etc. Nothing special and it is actually not difficult. But you have to make effort in reviewing the course material.
reviews.comment_teaching: Wang Shiheng is the best professor I ever seen. She can explain some complicated concept to us clearly. If you attend the class, I am quite sure that you are able to learn a lot from her.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair. It basically depends on your performance on midterm and final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: No workload basically. Just midterm and final, you have to review the course material only. But you also needa attend the class, as there will be small quiz in the class from time to time.

reviews.author: Cat
reviews.title: Finally not broken grade
reviews.comment_content:
content.. normal la, like contingent liability, finance lease, tax, payroll...i think in my opinion not as difficult as acct 3010

and then as usual la, have in class quiz and Wiley plus...
reviews.comment_teaching: I like her teaching, she is like a diplomatic spokeswoman and she is not feminine at all.... cool~
reviews.comment_grading:
As long it is high grade as i expected i will give A in terms of grading hahaha :)
I was deeply hurt after i got all C range in fall sem for acct courses :((((((

In this course,
midterm I was below mean a few marks (~0.3 SD), and mean was ~80/100 marks

Final I don't know

In the end I got B
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload when compared to projects in mgmt course zzzzzzzzzzzzz

reviews.author: Aiyana
reviews.comment_content: this course is an advanced course of acct 3010 and the content is quite similar. if you did well in 3010, it is very easy for you to catch up the lesson.
reviews.comment_teaching: i forgot the name of my professor but she worked in big 4 in shanghai before. although her english was hard to understand, her teaching was very clear and full of content.
reviews.comment_grading: the mean was quite high and the standard deviation was small. i got full mark in my midterm and homework and i also think i did very well in the final. however, i just got an A. so only getting all full marks can get an A+ in this course. no attendance was counted but attending the lesson helps you have a better understanding!
reviews.comment_workload: there are online quizzes every week but they were quite easy. just keep in mind that the quizzes will be easier if you pay attention on every lesson. if you have skipped any lesson, you have to spend much more time to understand the concept. so worth to take the lesson.

reviews.author: zoewtrmln
reviews.comment_content: This course focuses on consolidation. It gets progressively harder so make sure you grasp the first 3 chapters or else, it'd be hard to catch up. Reading from the PowerPoint slides and doing exercises from the textbook would be sufficient.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor basically teaches from the lecture slides and although he tries to explain the concepts as clearly as he can, he does get confused a lot (so heads up!).
reviews.comment_grading: According to him, he would not fail anyone from this course even if you score 0 for one of the exams. So, rest assured, if you're not aiming for A range, it would be quite easy to get a B if you hit around the mean.
reviews.comment_workload: We had 12-14 take-home exercises, which may sound like a lot but it isn't. Usually, just a few MCQs or one short answer question. These can be done within 30 mins to an hour. He isn't strict on handing them on time.

reviews.author: fina_toxicfm
reviews.title: Hard work won't pay off
reviews.comment_content:
Current liabilities, provisions and contingencies
Non-current liabilities
Equity
Dilutive securities and earnings per share
Investments
Accounting for income taxes
Accounting for pensions and post-retirement benefits
Accounting for leases
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a fun professor with clear illustration, but the grading is super poor at least for me.
reviews.comment_grading: I scored slightly above mean and median in total, still got a B-, which I have put so much effort on it. What do you think? (but you could also view it as UST standard)
reviews.comment_workload: Lots of workload and requires so much practice

reviews.author: KaruizawaKei
reviews.title: Hard work must pay off
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 13. Current liabilities, provisions and contingencies
Chapter 14. Non-current liabilities
Chapter 15. Equity
Chapter 16. Dilutive securities and earnings per share
Chapter 17. Investments
Chapter 19. Accounting for income taxes
Chapter 20. Accounting for pensions and postretirement
Chapter 21. Accounting for leases

8 Chapters, related to the debt and equity.
Daniel did not cover all contents, he did not cover the option in ch17, employees in ch20.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Excellent teaching. Daniel is passionate and humorous
Although his pace is a little bit fast, it is easy to follow. He explained the concepts in a detailed manner. He also shared some skills to compute the questions efficiently.
reviews.comment_grading:
Lenient grading.
Participation 5%
Everyone is assigned for 4% baseline score. No attendance!

4 homework assignments 15%
Very easy, each assignment covers 2 chapters.

Midterm exam 40%
Mean:65.2 S.D.:18 LQ:51.1 UQ:79.0

Final exam (non-cumulative) 40%
Mean:79.5 S.D.:13.8 LQ:70.75 UQ:91.0
Daniel intentionally made the final easier.

Some cutoff I heard about:
B-:70
B:75
A-:88
A:92
A+:94.5

Hard work must pay off. If someone claimed his hard work did not pay off, probably he overestimated the effort he put on this course.

reviews.author: 維他冇奶
reviews.comment_content:
教8課
有liability, lease, deferred tax 等等 不過內容都幾難完全明
reviews.comment_teaching:
教得幾清楚，不過有部分人會覺得教得太快
快到佢最後幾堂係用嚟俾人問問題:/ (因為已經教曬內容）
reviews.comment_grading:
兩份Hw : （一共30%）hw 1 12% hw2 18%
Hw 1 : 過mean 少少 , 踩median

Hw 2 : 都係過mean 少少 但below Median 啲啲

Classwork 5%
每隔幾堂就會有一份要你堂上做堂上交，你當attendance 咁



Final 冇出分唔知，最後A-
reviews.comment_workload: Hw 好難，所以要用好多時間去做：（ 好多細節位要留意，好似同lecture Note 兩個level )
